definition: to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects

sentences.english: In fact, no pigeon-holing is my mood.
sentences.chinese: 其实，无须对号入座的是我的心情。

sentences.english: When the boss makes general and negative comments, don’t take it personally.
sentences.chinese: 当老板进行泛泛的批评时，不要对号入座。

sentences.english: Please take your ticket and find your seat.
sentences.chinese: 请您携带入场券，对号入座。

sentences.english: The staff members asked the audience to sit in the right seats.
sentences.chinese: 工作人员要求观众对号入座。

sentences.english: Try not to take a study and compare it to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 不要看了一篇研究就拿自己对号入座。

sentences.english: The story I told was completely made-up, you shouldn't try to tell it to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 我说的这个故事创意纯属虚构，大家不要对号入座。

definition: dear reader/dear listener
tick/check mark (✓)/number for verification (serial number, seat number etc)/(fig.) two things match up
to pretend to understand when you don't
correct any mistakes you made, but maintain your good record if you did not make them (idiom)
pinyin: you3 ze2 gai3 zhi1 , wu2 ze2 jia1 mian3

definition: (lit.) to take a part for the whole/to generalize
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
to contrast/to compare/to place side by side for comparison (as parallel texts)/to check
everybody/all (guests, colleagues etc)/all of you
to define
lit. to draw a dipper with a gourd as one's model (idiom)/fig. to follow the existing pattern without modification
article/essay/literary works/writings/hidden meaning/CL:篇[pian1],段[duan4],頁|页[ye4]
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
(Internet slang) to imagine/to visualize
to classify/to categorize
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to make a wild guess/blind guess
